snippet: Many teachers were enthusiastic about the deal that would offer up to $20,000 per year in additional pay to those who took on leadership roles and remove some on absent teacher reserve.
abstract: Labor agreement announced by New York City and the United Federation of Teachers hews to Mayor Bill de Blasio's education vision, including his efforts to retain experienced teachers and improve outreach to parents; many teachers are enthusiastic about the deal.

byline.original: By JAVIER C. HERNÁNDEZ and AL BAKER

lead_paragraph: Many teachers were enthusiastic about the deal that would offer up to $20,000 per year in additional pay to those who took on leadership roles and remove some on absent teacher reserve.

headline.main: Under a New Agreement: More Bonuses and New Work Rules
headline.print_headline: Tentative Teacher Pact Hews to Mayor’s Vision
